definitions.text: a drawback or difficulty that is not readily evident
examples: it sounds good but what's the catch?

definitions.text: the quantity that was caught
examples: the catch was only 10 fish

definitions.text: a person regarded as a good matrimonial prospect
anything that is caught (especially if it is worth catching)
examples: he shared his catch with the others

definitions.text: a break or check in the voice (usually a sign of strong emotion)
a restraint that checks the motion of something
examples: he used a book as a stop to hold the door open

definitions.text: a fastener that fastens or locks a door or window
a cooperative game in which a ball is passed back and forth
examples: he played catch with his son in the backyard

definitions.text: the act of catching an object with the hands
examples: Mays made the catch with his back to the plate
he made a grab for the ball before it landed
Martin's snatch at the bridle failed and the horse raced away
the infielder's snap and throw was a single motion

definitions.text: the act of apprehending (especially apprehending a criminal)
examples: the policeman on the beat got credit for the collar

definitions.text: discover or come upon accidentally, suddenly, or unexpectedly; catch somebody doing something or in a certain state
examples: She caught her son eating candy
She was caught shoplifting

definitions.text: perceive with the senses quickly, suddenly, or momentarily
examples: I caught the aroma of coffee
He caught the allusion in her glance
ears open to catch every sound
The dog picked up the scent
Catch a glimpse

definitions.text: reach with a blow or hit in a particular spot
examples: the rock caught her in the back of the head
The blow got him in the back
The punch caught him in the stomach

definitions.text: take hold of so as to seize or restrain or stop the motion of
examples: Catch the ball!
Grab the elevator door!

definitions.text: succeed in catching or seizing, especially after a chase
examples: We finally got the suspect
Did you catch the thief?

definitions.text: to hook or entangle
examples: One foot caught in the stirrup

definitions.text: attract and fix
examples: His look caught her
She caught his eye
Catch the attention of the waiter

definitions.text: capture as if by hunting, snaring, or trapping
examples: I caught a rabbit in the trap today

definitions.text: reach in time
examples: I have to catch a train at 7 o'clock

definitions.text: get or regain something necessary, usually quickly or briefly
examples: Catch some sleep
catch one's breath

definitions.text: catch up with and possibly overtake
examples: The Rolls Royce caught us near the exit ramp

definitions.text: be struck or affected by
examples: catch fire
catch the mood

definitions.text: check oneself during an action
examples: She managed to catch herself before telling her boss what was on her mind

definitions.text: hear, usually without the knowledge of the speakers
examples: We overheard the conversation at the next table

definitions.text: see or watch
examples: view a show on television
This program will be seen all over the world
view an exhibition
Catch a show on Broadway
see a movie

definitions.text: cause to become accidentally or suddenly caught, ensnared, or entangled
examples: I caught the hem of my dress in the brambles

definitions.text: detect a blunder or misstep
examples: The reporter tripped up the senator

definitions.text: grasp with the mind or develop an understanding of
examples: did you catch that allusion?
We caught something of his theory in the lecture
don't catch your meaning
did you get it?
She didn't get the joke
I just don't get him

definitions.text: contract
examples: did you catch a cold?

definitions.text: start burning
examples: The fire caught

definitions.text: perceive by hearing
examples: I didn't catch your name
She didn't get his name when they met the first time

definitions.text: suffer from the receipt of
examples: She will catch hell for this behavior!

definitions.text: attract; cause to be enamored
examples: She captured all the men's hearts

definitions.text: apprehend and reproduce accurately
examples: She really caught the spirit of the place in her drawings
She got the mood just right in her photographs

definitions.text: take in and retain
examples: We have a big barrel to catch the rainwater

definitions.text: spread or be communicated
examples: The fashion did not catch

definitions.text: be the catcher
examples: Who is catching?

definitions.text: become aware of
examples: he caught her staring out the window

definitions.text: delay or hold up; prevent from proceeding on schedule or as planned
examples: I was caught in traffic and missed the meeting
